data.title: No longer!
data.text: This was a great Mexican place but it has been closed for some time.  The new place is called Sauced and serves mainly pork and tex-mex dishes.

data.title: It's just not that good
data.text: Rumor has it this place is closing, and if it's true I'm not surprised. It's too bad - it's a great location and the idea of sitting in the theatre square courtyard with a pitcher of margaritas is appealing. Actually, the picture of margaritas is pretty good. The food is pretty 'meh'. This is California so it's not really unreasonable to have fairly high expectations of Mexican food. I get it that this is a large and probably fairly costly venue, so why not serve some really gourmet Mexican food and charge accordingly? instead, this isn't really any better than Chili's and it's not cheap. The acoustics are terrible. Unless you're off in one of the side areas,, the noise is ridiculous. They need a few hombres who can actually cook.

data.title: Great for Lunch
data.text: We had a really good lunch at Tres Hombres.  Very good food and attentive service.  The outdoor seating was comfortable and great for people watching.  Very nice location in downtown Petaluma.

data.title: Good food, expensive!
data.text: The food was normal Mexican food. The menu was small and the items were expensive. The portion size was good. If you are looking for a clean, good atmosphere, decent Mexican food establishment try them out! The salsa was great!!

data.title: Surprise Party for Relatives
data.text: Great food, great service, very accommodating staff for a large party.  Could of used a bit more space for arriving and waiting for sitting down.  But otherwise, recommend restaurant for a party!

data.title: Sunday Champagne Brunch
data.text:
The Tres Hombres has changed their selections for their "Sunday Champagne Brunch", however: it wasn't a positive change. 

Also, my wife and I like to sit in a little larger table because we don't like tables that are cluttered with no room to comfortably eat. I don't think they appreciated us asking for a larger table. One time we went for brunch and the waitress poured our glass with champagne and left the bottle for us. The next time we went, the waitress poured our glass, took the bottle and never came back. I don't have to tell how we felt about that lack of service. 

The Tres Hombres brunch selection used to have a wider and more flavorful selection. I cannot figure out why they decided to go with their present menu. 

I would however, highly recommend their regular menu as it contains very delicious and traditional items.

data.title: Not good plalnning.
data.text: Our last visit here was using a Groupon. they were totally unprepared for the number of people who showed up. They ran out of pretty much everything at one point or another. Not a good experience.

data.title: Hmmmm...miscalculation? or overall bad planning?
data.text:
While planning my trip, I visited Groupon and Living Social for the opportunity to try some random restraunts in towns we are visiting.  When I saw the Unlimited Brunch for 4 with Bottomless Champagne Groupon at Tres Hombres, I had to get it as we were visiting for my dad's 79th birthday and thought this would be perfect!  

First problem...when you get the address to Tres Hombres and aren't from Petaluma...you will be LOST.  As my poor mom and dad followed we headed to where 151 Petaluma Blvd SHOULD be and were right behind a woman with a Living Social certificate looking for the same restaurant and asking a shop owner where it was.  Turns out there is a Petaluma Blvd. and then a Petaluma Blvd. South where the odd numbers are on the opposite side of the street...and this restaurant is actually inside a cobbled "paseo" across from a MOVIE theater, not the Petaluma Theatre that I was expecting.  SO...once we had hoofed it a few blocks we got to the restaurant at 1:30pm on Sunday.  Let me reiterate that we had a Groupon for the unlimited brunch and champagne which did NOT say we needed reservations, plus said was served from 11-2.  

As soon as we walked up we were told that they were no longer serving brunch AT ALL because they had "run out of eggs, run out of champagne," etc.

I proceeded to say that I was only in town for a couple of days only and that the Groupon would be of no use to me on any other day and I had meant it to be a birthday brunch.  The owner/manager (?) did allow me to use the Groupon for face value toward the lunch menu.  I was actually satisfied with this at the time, but as I have thought about it...I had purchased a certificate that had a value of 4 brunches at $19.99 each and instead they covered the $32 that I paid for the certificate.  I could have gone anywhere...hmmm...

The food was decent.  Nothing that I would write home about.  I got 2 tropical fish tacos which were very very light on the fish.  Clearly they had also run out of ice in their mad rush of Groupon/Living Social users (what restaurant puts BOTH of these out on the same week!?) as our water and iced tea had no ice.  I had to ask for utensils, straws, napkins, etc.  

It's a bit hard to blame the servers if they were completely swamped from 11-1, but they were clearly taking their breather after the insanity of the morning...no chip refills, no drink refills, nothing extra at all.

After our experience I would probably never return to this restaurant on a future trip.  What I was hoping would be a lovely all-you-can-eat brunch with champagne and dessert ended up being a couple of stingy tacos and warm iced tea.  Bummer.  Sorry dad!  Hope I made up for it today!  ;)

data.title: outstanding service, pleasant atmosphere, really good food
data.text: We were asked to find a venue for an early lunch meeting for visiting functionaries.  Tres Hombres opens at 11:30 for lunch, but they cheerfully agreed to seat us at 11:00.  When we arrived they offered us a private space (it even had a curtain that pulled across to give us privacy).  The server was friendly and helpful and the food was very tasty.  Our guests were impressed and I can't wait to go back and try the tequila bar!

data.title: Nice outdoor seating
data.text:
I like going here because of the great outdoor seating by the fountain in the theatre dist.
You cant beat their all you can eat taco day. Great after you have visited the wed. farmers market or before a movie at the theatre.

data.title: Eh..
data.text: The restaurant looks like gold, polished, spacious, A+.  The food is, well, so, so.  The service could be better.  The price is nice, but the decor and the food are just off.  Why impress with the locale and let down on the food?  I wish I could say the opposite, but I cannot.

data.title: No Bueno!
data.text: We came here with a small Birthday group on a slow Monday night and were seated in a nice semi-private booth. My wife and I just wanted a couple of grande house margaritas and the waiter advised that a pitcher would be about the same price. He mumbled something about agave nectar and some brand of Tequila. Well, he came back with some  watered down and tasteless (from the start) concoction that consisted of half ice and very little sign of Tequila. When the bill came we were pretty shocked to see that they had charged $32 for the pitcher.After tax and tip we apparently paid around $40 for this swill.  The food was adequate, and the server polite, but this is BAD policy and I've never felt quite this ripped off before.

data.title: Blahh
data.text: The most Americanized "Mexican" restaurant I've ever been to. Enough said.

data.title: Overpriced, bad margaritas and so-so food
data.text:
Warning:  The margaritas come out of a slurpee machine located near the beer tappers.  If you want a good margarita, you will be horribly disappointed.  Not only do they come out of a machine, but they are also super sicky-sweet with some low-grade trace of alcohol that can't even be tasted served in a low-ball glass.  

The food was mediocre and expensive.  We ordered an appetizer that was basically like two little chimicangas sliced into bite-size bits for $9.95.  I ordered for my entree fish tacos that were pretty good but still overpriced for what I got - just two fish tacos (no rice or beans).  

Service was pretty good - no complaints there.

data.title: KILLER Fish Tacos
data.text: The tacos are really good. I  was there last night and had a really good time.

data.title: Fantastico
data.text: Tres Hombres is one of the best things that has happened to Downtown Petaluma. I'm not sure which is my favorite the Long bar with over 200 tequila's, the taco bar, or the outside patio with margarita's in the sun. All the employees are friendly and eager to help and make you feel at home. The fiesta atmosphere allows our family to enjoy lunch or dinner without having to worry about our 5 year old not being entertained. And they have the Best Margaritas in town.

data.title: Nom nom nom
data.text: Tres hombres had delicious food, reasonable prices and amazing margaritas. We would definitely go back. Yummy!

data.title: Mexican food was worst I've ever had at a...
data.text: Mexican food was worst I've ever had at a "Mexican" cuisine restaurant. Salsas were ok, and the bar looked great. Besides that I was  throughly disapointed

data.title: Great location..downtown...
data.text: Great location..downtown by the face-fountain. Good food.....

data.title: Tres Hombres Restaurant not tres great
data.text: I recently ate at a new restaurant in the new theatre district, Tres Hombres.  I was so disappointed.  The waitress got several of our orders wrong.  We were charged for an extra entree that we never ordered and the food was mediocre and overpriced.  They didn't even have shredded or ground beef as an option, only steak.  I like shredded meat, so I got the pork, which was ok, but not great.  I ordered water, but it tasted so bad, like chlorine and chemicals that I ended up ordering a soda.  The only good thing was their chips were hot and fresh.    If you want good, reasonably priced Mexican food, go to Velascos.
